macros.sourceContext:
|

For elements that normally take user input, such as a {{HTMLElement("textarea")}}, the initial value of -moz-user-input is enabled.

|
> |

Note: -moz-user-input was one of the proposals leading to the proposed CSS 3 {{cssxref("user-input")}} property, which has not yet reached Candidate Recommendation (call for implementations). A similar property, user-focus, was proposed in early drafts of a predecessor of the User Interface for CSS3 specification, but was rejected by the working group.

^ |
|

Syntax

title: -moz-user-input
summary: In Mozilla applications, -moz-user-input determines if an element will accept user input.
